subject: Cybersecurity
title: Diffie-Hellman: Sharing Secrets in Public
description: A quick win: understand Diffie-Hellman: Sharing Secrets in Public.

hook.text: Two people can agree on a secret key by shouting numbers in a crowded room. Nobody else can figure it out.

buildup.text: In 1976, Diffie and Hellman invented a way to create a shared secret over an insecure channel.

discovery.text: Each party picks a private number, does math with a public number, and exchanges results. The shared secret emerges.

twist.text: Eavesdroppers see the public exchange but can't compute the shared secret â€” it's like unmixing paint colors.

climax.text: Diffie-Hellman solved the key distribution problem and made secure internet communication possible.

punchline.text: Two strangers can create a shared secret in plain sight.

quiz.question: What problem did Diffie-Hellman key exchange solve?
options: Sharing a secret key over an insecure channel
